questions.text: Identify the correctly matched pair:
All of the following muscles have dual nerve supply except?
For which of the following parasites is NNN medium used for isolation? Leishmania donovani Giardia E. histolytica Trichomonas vaginalis Trypanosoma cruzi
The caecum is found to be placed below the stomach and is midline. Which of the following abnormalities must have taken place while rotation of the gut?

A patient in the intensive care unit develops a central line-associated bloodstream infection (CLABSI). The medical team is discussing the pathophysiology of these infections in relation to central venous catheters. What is the primary mechanism by which central lines predispose patients to bloodstream infections?

options.label: A
options.text: Direct inoculation of bacteria into the bloodstream during catheter insertion

options.label: B
options.text: Hematogenous spread from a distant infection site

options.label: C
options.text: Formation of biofilms on the catheter surface

options.label: D
options.text: Leakage of infusate along the outside of the catheter

questions.correct_answer: C. Formation of biofilms on the catheter surface
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Formation of biofilms on the catheter surface

questions.text: A 28-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a deep laceration to his forearm sustained during a machinery accident at work. The wound is located in the forearm's anterolateral region, and bleeding is controlled. On physical examination, there is concern for potential damage to critical structures. Which of the following arteries is most likely to pierce the interosseous membrane of the forearm and be at risk for injury in this patient?

A 19-year-old man comes to the physician due to diarrhea for the last 4 months. He visited a student health clinic at his university a month ago and was prescribed a course of antibiotics, but his diarrhea failed to improve. He also has persistent nausea, a bloating sensation, and a 6.8-kg weight loss. Microscopic examination of his stool is shown in the image. Impairment of which of the following immune functions would most likely predispose to this patient's infection?

A male patient with benign hypertrophy of the prostate was hospitalized for three weeks. During his stay, he developed signs suggestive of a catheter-associated urinary tract infection (UTI). The tip of his urinary catheter was cultured on blood agar and, after 24 hours, the agar showed the distinctive pattern as in the image provided. Which organism is most likely the causative agent of the UTI in this patient?
Which of the following structures passes through the pointed Foramen?

A 40-year-old patient presents with a severe bacterial infection. During diagnostic testing, a Gram stain of the causative organism reveals a pink/red coloration. Based on this Gram staining result, which component(s) are characteristic of the cell wall of this organism?

A 45-year-old patient presents to the neurology clinic with complaints of weakness and clumsiness in their hand, particularly involving the ulnar-sided fingers. The physician is evaluating for possible ulnar nerve injury and discusses various diagnostic tests during the examination. Which of the following tests is NOT typically used to detect ulnar nerve injury?

A 31-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 2-day history of abdominal pain and diarrhea. He reports that his stools are streaked with blood and mucus. He returned from a vacation in Kerala 3 weeks ago. His vital signs are within normal limits. Abdominal examination shows hyperactive bowel sounds. A photomicrograph of a trichrome-stained wet mount of a stool specimen is shown. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?

MRI of 60-year-old female reveals a defect in the territory served by the artery marked in given MRA. Which of the following features is not a component of the syndrome related to the vessel indicated by the yellow arrows:

options.label: A
options.text: Contralateral loss of pain & temperature in trunk and limbs

options.label: B
options.text: Contralateral loss of position and vibration sense

options.label: C
options.text: Ipsilateral loss of pain and temperature sensation from face

options.label: D
options.text: Ipsilateral paralysis of muscles of palate

questions.correct_answer: B. Contralateral loss of position and vibration sense
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Contralateral loss of position and vibration sense

questions.text: Identify the Organ in this given Slide.
Which method is typically not used to determine the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of an antibiotic?

Branches from Second Part of Maxillary Artery are: Middle Meningeal Artery Masseteric Artery Sphenopalatine Artery Buccal Artery Accessory Meningeal Artery Anterior Tympanic Artery Deep Temporal Artery
What is the mechanism of action of the toxin produced by the bacterium whose biochemical tests are shown in the figure below?

A 69-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by his wife because of fever, cough, diarrhea, and confusion for 2 days. He recently returned from a cruise to the Caribbean. He has a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 40 years. His temperature is 39.1°C (102.4°F), pulse is 83/min, and blood pressure is 111/65 mm Hg. He is confused and oriented only to person. Physical examination shows coarse crackles throughout both lung fields. His serum sodium concentration is 125 mEq/L. Culture of the most likely causal organism would require which of the following mediums?

A 52-year-old man comes to the clinic complaining of a sudden loss of taste on the front two-thirds of his tongue. He denies any facial weakness, ear pain, or changes in his ability to produce tears when he yawns or eats. He has no history of recent illness, trauma, or ear infections. Physical examination does not reveal any facial asymmetry or abnormality in lacrimation. Given these findings, you consider the anatomy of the facial nerve and its branches that convey taste sensation from the anterior two-thirds of the tongue.
questions.correct_answer: D. Between Genu and Pyramidal Eminence
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Between Genu and Pyramidal Eminence

questions.text: What is the primary function of the CRISPR system in bacteria?

options.label: A
options.text: To facilitate horizontal gene transfer between bacterial cells

options.label: B
options.text: To enable bacteria to resist viral infections through sequence-specific DNA cleavage

options.label: C
options.text: To allow the incorporation of viral DNA into the bacterial genome

options.label: D
options.text: To protect bacteria from the eukaryotic immune system

questions.correct_answer: B. To enable bacteria to resist viral infections through sequence-specific DNA cleavage
questions.explanation: Ans. B) To enable bacteria to resist viral infections through sequence-specific DNA cleavage.

questions.text: A 55-year-old man with a history of smoking and hypertension presents to the clinic with difficulty swallowing and hoarseness. On examination, he has a decreased gag reflex and asymmetry of the soft palate with uvula deviating to the left upon phonation. These findings suggest a lesion in which of the following structures?

A 65-year-old man with a history of COPD presents with a chronic cough and a solitary pulmonary nodule on chest imaging. Histopathology from a bronchoscopic biopsy of the nodule shows spherules filled with endospores. Which antifungal agent is most appropriate for the treatment of this patient's infection?
Which is the method for making the inoculation for antibiotic sensitivity testing shown here?
What type of Gland is shown in the given image?
What is the typical resolving power of a standard light microscope, which limits its ability to distinguish two closely spaced objects as separate?
Which of the following statements is correct about the nerve involved in causing the deformity in the given image?

options.label: A
options.text: It passes superficial to the flexor retinaculum

options.label: B
options.text: In the lower half of forearm it has a subfascial course

options.label: C
options.text: It enters the palm on the ulnar side of pisiform bone

options.label: D
options.text: It rests on the flexor carpi ulnaris

questions.correct_answer: A. It passes superficial to the flexor retinaculum
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Itpasses superficial to the flexor retinaculum

questions.text: 52-year-old man is hospitalized due to 2 weeks of low-grade fever, malaise, anorexia, and fatigue. The patient has a history of bicuspid aortic valve and underwent aortic valve replacement a month ago. Physical examination reveals a new regurgitation murmur. Blood cultures repeatedly grow gram-positive cocci in clusters. This pathogen most likely demonstrates which of the following characteristics?

A 23-year-old man comes to the OPD due to penile ulcers that appeared after unprotected sexual intercourse. Physical examination shows 3 subcentimeter ulcers on the penile shaft. Microscopic examination of a scraping from an ulcer base reveals the following. Which of the following medications is most appropriate for this patient?

A 60-year-old man who is an avid gardener in the Mississippi River Valley presents with a chronic cough, night sweats, and weight loss. A chest X-ray shows diffuse reticulonodular infiltrates. He undergoes a bronchoalveolar lavage, and the fluid shows macrophages filled with intracellular, oval yeast cells. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A microbiology lab receives a sputum sample from a patient with a suspected hospital-acquired pneumonia. The organism isolated grows on Simmons' citrate agar with a blue color change. Which of the following organisms is most likely responsible for this finding?

A 30-year-old female presented to the orthopedician with complaints of pain behind the right knee and pain over the right leg. She said that pain increased with ambulation, forward flexion and on ascending stairs. On examination of the right knee in semi flexed position, a palpable pulsatile mass was felt at the level of the knee joint. The patient was diagnosed with popliteal artery aneurysm after seeing its features in an MRI. Surgery was planned. Which of the following statements is true pertaining to this case?

options.label: A
options.text: The Popliteal Artery divides at the Inferior Angle of Popliteal Fossa into its Terminal Branches

options.label: B
options.text: The Artery lies in Close Contact with the Roof of the Popliteal Fossa

options.label: C
options.text: The Popliteal Vein intervenes between the Popliteal Artery & Tibial Nerve

options.label: D
options.text: Cutaneous Branches from Popliteal Artery supply Lower part of Back of Thigh

questions.correct_answer: C. The Popliteal Vein intervenes between the Popliteal Artery & Tibial Nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The Popliteal Vein intervenes between the Popliteal Artery & Tibial Nerve

questions.text: A 7-year-old girl is brought to the outpatient department with a 10-day history of abdominal pain, intermittent diarrhea, and mild weight loss. Her family reports no significant travel history or exposure to pets. Stool microscopy reveals eggs characteristic of a specific helminth infection shown below. Given this diagnosis, what is the most appropriate treatment for her condition?
Danger Space of Neck lies between:

options.label: B
options.text: Alar Fascia and Posterior Layer of Prevertebral Fascia

questions.correct_answer: B. Alar Fascia and Posterior Layer of Prevertebral Fascia
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Alar Fascia and Posterior Layer of Prevertebral Fascia

questions.text: Where does the Golgi Apparatus in Serous Acinar Cells located?

A 56-year-old man presents with fever and right upper quadrant abdominal pain. Blood cultures grow a Gram-negative rod. The organism is inoculated on TSI agar, showing acid slant/acid butt with gas production. This biochemical reaction pattern is most consistent with which of the following organisms?
Where in the body is the tissue shown in the image typically found?

A 45-year-old postrenal transplant patient presents with diarrhea three months after the transplant. Stool microscopy reveals spherical organisms that are Kinyoun stain positive. Epifluorescence microscopy is shown. What is the most likely causative agent?
This is a schematic diagram depicting body structure of which of these helminthes?

A 16-year-old boy was diagnosed with urethral stricture. He underwent visual internal urethrotomy in the lithotomy position with stirrups supporting both popliteal fossa and proximal parts of tibia. No ankle support was used. On the first postoperative day, the patient complained of decreased sensation on the lateral aspect of right leg, the lateral border of his right foot and difficulty in dorsiflexion of the right foot due to compression of a particular nerve of the lower limb. Which of the following muscles is supplied by the nerve involved in this scenario?
New Delhi metallo-beta-lactamase (NDM-1) confers resistance to which class of antibiotics?

A 60-year-old man with uncontrolled diabetes mellitus presents with high-grade fever, chills, and visual disturbances. Blood cultures are taken, and empirical antifungal therapy is initiated. Laboratory reports later reveal positive (1,3)-β-D-Glucan. Which of the following infections is most likely present in this patient?

A 54-year-old man from the Northeastern States presents to the clinic with a 1-week history of fever, fatigue, and myalgia. Physical examination reveals mild jaundice, and laboratory tests show hemolytic anemia. A peripheral blood smear is performed, revealing the following: Based on the patient's history, clinical presentation, and the peripheral blood smear findings, which vector is most likely involved in the spread of the disease?

A 55-year-old man with a history of chronic liver disease presents to the clinic for a routine check-up. During the examination, you discuss various structures associated with the liver. You explain to the patient that one of the following structures, which he might have heard of in the context of liver disease, is not a derivative of the septum transversum. Which structure is this?

A 47-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with severe right upper quadrant abdominal pain that started 6 hours ago. The pain is constant, sharp, and worsens with deep breathing. She also reports experiencing nausea and a mild fever. Her medical history is significant for obesity and high cholesterol. On examination, you note a positive Murphy's sign. An ultrasound of the abdomen is ordered, which shows gallstones and a thickened gallbladder wall. Given these findings, which type of epithelium is most likely to be found lining the mucosa of this patient's gallbladder?
Which bacterial toxin acts by inhibiting protein synthesis via ADP-ribosylation of elongation factor 2?

A 58-year-old male presents with chronic lower back pain that worsens when standing or walking and slightly improves when sitting. Radiographic imaging shows degenerative changes in the lumbar spine. His medical history includes a long-standing issue with lumbar spinal stenosis. Which component of the Ligamentum Flavum, known to be involved in the pathophysiology of lumbar spinal stenosis, is likely to be altered in this patient?

A previously healthy individual suddenly develops symptoms of acute meningoencephalitis, including severe headache, fever, and altered mental status. Upon further investigation, it is found that the individual had been swimming in a warm freshwater lake recently. Wet mount of CSF is shown. What is the most likely cause of this condition?

A 32-year-old man is being evaluated due to several weeks of watery diarrhea. He has also had intermittent, crampy abdominal pain and has lost 7 kg during this period. The patient has a history of HIV and was hospitalized 6 months ago for Pneumocystis pneumonia. Stool tests for leukocytes and occult blood are negative. Endoscopy is performed, and mucosal biopsy is shown. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

A 23-year-old female, manual labourer at a construction site, accidentally stepped over a sharp-edged blade in the site, following which there was severe bleeding from her sole. She was taken to a nearby hospital, where with much difficulty, the bleeding was arrested and cut ends were sutured.Which of the following statements pertaining to the above case is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood supply to sole is from branches of posterior tibial artery

options.label: B
options.text: Lateral plantar artery is the larger terminal branch and forms the plantar arterial arch

options.label: C
options.text: Plantar arterial arch will give rise to four plantar metatarsal arteries

options.label: D
options.text: Plantar arterial arch lies between the second & third layer of sole

questions.correct_answer: D. Plantar arterial arch lies between the second & third layer of sole
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Plantar arterial arch lies between the second & third layer of sole

questions.text: A biotechnology student is presenting on the process of creating monoclonal antibodies using hybridoma technology. She discusses various aspects of this technique. Which of the following statements she makes about hybridoma technology is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Specific antibody-producing cells are fused with myeloma cells to create hybridomas.

options.label: B
options.text: Myeloma cells in the salvage pathway can grow in HAT medium.

options.label: C
options.text: Aminopterin, a component of HAT medium, inhibits the denovo pathway of nucleotide synthesis.

options.label: D
options.text: HGPRTase and thymidylate synthetase enzymes are necessary for the survival of cells in the salvage pathway.

questions.correct_answer: B. Myeloma cells in the salvage pathway can grow in HAT medium.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Myeloma cells in the salvage pathway can grow in HAT medium.

questions.text: A 15-year-old girl presented with fever, hypotension, and skin rash. She had a tampon in situ for 24 hours. A bacterial cause is suspected. Which of the following toxin is not involved in this condition?

A patient presents with a history of skin itching and a rash following a camping trip. He reports contact with soil and water bodies. Which of the following parasites is least likely to have entered his body through the skin?

A 22-year-old athlete presents with pain in the posterior aspect of his hip after a sprinting injury. On examination, the pain is localized to the ischial tuberosity. Which of the following muscles is most likely involved, given its attachment to the ischial tuberosity?

A 25-year-old man presents to the clinic complaining of a small, painless lump at the upper pole of his left testis. He denies any history of trauma or infection. On examination, the lump is non-tender, mobile, and located at the head of the epididymis. The remainder of the testicular examination is normal. The physician reassures the patient about the benign nature of the lump and discusses its embryological origin. The appendix of the testis, as found in this patient, develops from which of the following structures?

A 4-year-old boy presents with a history of recurrent skin and soft tissue infections. He has had several episodes of deep-seated abscesses requiring surgical intervention. Notably, he had a hepatic abscess drained two years ago and more recently underwent incision and drainage for cervical lymphadenitis. The pus cultures frequently grow Staphylococcus aureus. A notable laboratory finding is a positive nitroblue-tetrazolium test. What is the most probable diagnosis?

During a Forensic Medicine Conference, a detailed discussion is held on the mechanisms of death in cases of judicial hanging. One of the topics focuses on the anatomical structures involved in the upper cervical spine and their role in the cause of death when subjected to the forces involved in hanging. A case is presented where an individual subjected to judicial hanging was found to have significant cervical spine injuries during the autopsy. Based on the anatomical and forensic analysis, which of the following structures is most likely to be involved in causing death due to rupture in cases of judicial hanging?
Which of the following Structure does not pass through the Gap between Superior and Middle Constrictor of Pharynx?
Which of the following is the most likely cause of this presentation?

Which of the following features are characteristic of the Anopheles mosquito? Stripes on wings Larva rests at an angle to water surface Adult rests at an angle to the surface of the skin Eggs laid in clusters No siphon tube in larvae

A 65-year-old man with a history of diabetes and chronic kidney disease presents to the emergency department with fever, hypotension, and a raised white cell count. His skin is warm and flushed, but there is no rash, desquamation, or signs of localized infection. Blood cultures are pending. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis if this patient's condition is not primarily due to a toxin-mediated effect?

Following renal transplantation, a patient develops fever and allograft tenderness within the first 2 months’ post-procedure. Which of the following infections is most likely responsible for these clinical findings?

Sequential arrangement of secretomotor pathway to lacrimal gland: Pons Nerve of pterygoid canal Geniculate ganglion Nervus intermedius Lacrimal nerve Greater petrosal nerve Pterygopalatine ganglion Zygomaticotemporal nerve

In the case of an elderly male presenting with meningitis, a gram stain of the CSF sample shows the presence of gram-positive bacilli. Which of the following statements accurately pertains to the motility of the responsible microorganism?
questions.correct_answer: C. Motile at 25° C, non-motile at 37°C

questions.text: A group of medical students are learning about the femoral sheath and its contents during a clinical skills session. They are asked to identify the structures contained within the femoral sheath. Which of the following options correctly lists the contents of the femoral sheath?

options.label: A
options.text: Femoral Artery, Femoral Vein, Femoral Nerve

options.label: B
options.text: Femoral Artery, Femoral Vein, Deep Inguinal Lymph Nodes

options.label: C
options.text: Femoral Artery, Femoral Nerve, Lymphatic Vessels

options.label: D
options.text: Femoral Vein, Femoral Nerve, Lymphatic Vessels

questions.correct_answer: B. Femoral Artery, Femoral Vein, Deep Inguinal Lymph Nodes
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Femoral Artery, Femoral Vein, Deep Inguinal Lymph Nodes

questions.text: A laboratory scientist is presented with two bacterial isolates from a skin infection. Both are gram-positive cocci, but it is critical to determine whether the isolates are Staphylococcus spp. or Micrococcus spp. to guide treatment effectively. Which test would best differentiate between these two genera?

A 38-year-old male patient presents with a 6-month history of progressive dyspnea on exertion and occasional chest pain. Physical examination reveals elevated jugular venous pressure and a diastolic murmur heard at the left sternal border. An echocardiogram confirms the diagnosis of severe aortic regurgitation. During surgery to repair the aortic valve, the surgeon encounters the left superior intercostal vein. Which vessel is most likely to receive the blood drained by the left superior intercostal vein in this patient?

A 2-week-old neonate presents with poor feeding, jaundice, and a low-grade fever. On examination, there is hepatosplenomegaly. The mother had a febrile illness during the third trimester of pregnancy, but did not seek medical attention. Laboratory tests show thrombocytopenia and elevated liver enzymes. An ophthalmologic examination reveals chorioretinitis. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial diagnostic test?
Match the following structures with the appropriate cross-section level of brainstem?
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A-1, B-4,C-5, D-6, E-3, F-2

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman comes to the physician for an annual pelvic examination and Pap smear. Her last Pap smear was 3 years ago. A photomicrograph of cervical cells from the Pap smear specimen is shown. Cells similar to the one indicated by the arrow are most likely to be seen in which of the following conditions?

A laboratory researcher is studying the pathogenesis of Staphylococcus aureus and focuses on the toxins that contribute to its virulence. One group of toxins has been noted to have synergistic hemolytic activity on sheep blood agar when combined with other staphylococcal hemolysins. Which toxin is known for this synergistic activity?

Patient's chest X-ray revealed an abnormal shadow in the pulmonary hilum region, prompting concern for potential mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Clinical examination and additional imaging recommended to assess for underlying causes such as infection or malignancy. Patient advised to follow up with a pulmonologist for further evaluation and management. Which is the most inferior structure in the right hilum in lung?
Which of the following viruses will not need RT-PCR for its detection?
Which of the following is a synchondrosis joint?
Which of the following condition is characterized by a loss of vibration sensation on the right side and a loss of pain and temperature sensation on the left side?

A 25-year-old female presents to the clinic with a sore throat, fever, and difficulty swallowing. On examination, she has pharyngeal erythema and tonsillar exudate without any signs of a cough. A rapid antigen detection test is negative, and a throat culture is obtained. While awaiting culture results, a Bacitracin sensitivity disk test is performed, as shown in the image. Which organism is most likely responsible for her symptoms?

A third-year medical student is reviewing cardiac anatomy in preparation for her cardiology rotation. She focuses on the atrial anatomy pertinent to electrophysiological studies. Which of the following best describes the boundaries of Koch's triangle, an important anatomical landmark for atrioventricular (AV) node location?

options.label: A
options.text: The septal leaflet of the tricuspid valve, the opening of the coronary sinus, and the tendon of Todaro

options.label: B
options.text: The anterior and posterior leaflets of the mitral valve and the opening of the coronary sinus

options.label: C
options.text: The anterior and posterior leaflets of the tricuspid valve and the opening of the inferior vena cava

options.label: D
options.text: The septal and posterior leaflets of the tricuspid valve and the opening of the superior vena cava

questions.correct_answer: A. The septal leaflet of the tricuspid valve, the opening of the coronary sinus, and the tendon of Todaro
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The septal leaflet of the tricuspid valve, the opening of the coronary sinus, and the tendon of Todaro

questions.text: A 45-year-old male presents to the clinic complaining of fever, headache, and a persistent dry cough. He mentions that his symptoms started a few days after he was cleaning an old, abandoned aviary. His physical examination is unremarkable except for mild respiratory distress. A chest X-ray is performed, revealing interstitial infiltrates. Laboratory investigations, including serology, indicate atypical pneumonia with inclusion bodies suggestive of a zoonotic infection. Based on these findings, the physician is considering the diagnosis of a specific zoonotic atypical pneumonia. Which inclusion body is most likely associated with this patient’s diagnosis?

A 28-year-old male has recently returned from mountains. He reports that he was bitten by some insect. A few days later he developed fever, malaise and a black eschar on the site of the bite. The image of his hand is shown below. Which of the following drugs should be prescribed to the patient?

A 45-year-old patient presents with a sudden, severe headache, visual disturbances, and difficulty moving the left eye outward. Imaging reveals an aneurysm near the Circle of Willis. Which cranial nerve is most likely to be compressed between the superior cerebellar artery and posterior cerebral artery due to the aneurysm?

During a surgical rotation, a medical student observes that a patient with a deep skin infection has rapid spreading of the infection through the fascial planes. The attending physician explains that certain bacterial exoenzymes facilitate the spread of infection by degrading connective tissue components. Which Streptococcus exoenzyme is primarily responsible for the breakdown of connective tissue, contributing to the spread of the infection?

A 28-year-old woman presents to the clinic with shortness of breath and a dry cough. A chest X-ray reveals a small left apical pneumothorax. The physician explains to the medical student that the pneumothorax has not extended into the neck due to the presence of a specific anatomical structure. Which of the following structures is most likely responsible for limiting the spread of the pneumothorax?

A 30-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a low-grade fever and a localized tender lesion on her arm. She recalls being scratched by her new kitten a week ago. On examination, you note a small papule at the scratch site and an enlarged axillary lymph node. A biopsy of the lymph node shows stellate granuloma with central necrosis surrounded by neutrophils. Which organism is most likely responsible for her condition?

A 59-year-old male was brought to ER with complaints of profuse upper GI bleed. His past history couldn’t be obtained. His BP was 60/40mmHg and his PR 140/min. Inspite of immediate resuscitation measures initiated, the patient failed to survive. Autopsy showed a deep peptic ulcer in the lesser curvature of stomach. Which of the following arteries would have been penetrated by the ulcer?

A 35-year-old man presented with high fever, bleeding gums, myalgia, and hepatosplenomegaly. His TLC is 3100, Hb- 11g/dl, hematocrit - 55%, and platelets - 25,000 cells. What is the most important prognostic factor in this condition?

A 45-year-old man with diabetes presents with a tender swelling on his forehead. Incision and drainage yield foul-smelling pus that fluoresces red under ultraviolet light. What is the most likely causative organism?
Which of the following is not a likely consequence of occlusion of the artery supplying the indicated area?

A 25-year-old male who recently returned from a hiking trip in the mountains presents with fever and a rash. Laboratory tests show elevated Weil-Felix reaction titers, Ox 2, and Ox 19. Which organism is most likely responsible for his symptoms?
The following plate shows H. influenzae colonies. Which of the following is responsible for the phenomenon shown?
Match the following:

A 2-week-old infant is brought to the emergency department by his parents due to a sudden onset of fever, poor feeding, and irritability. The infant was born at term without complications, but the mother reports that she consumed soft cheese during the third trimester. On examination, the infant is lethargic and has a bulging fontanelle. Lumbar puncture is performed, revealing gram-positive rods in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). Which organism is most likely responsible for these findings?

A 35-year-old woman presents to the clinic with fatigue, weight loss, and a feeling of fullness in her left upper abdomen. She has a history of chronic immune thrombocytopenia. On physical examination, her spleen is palpable below the left costal margin. The enlargement of her spleen is significant but does not extend into the lower abdomen. Which of the following anatomical structures is most likely preventing the downward displacement of her enlarged spleen?

A 27-year-old pregnant woman at 8 weeks gestation, known to have an allergy to penicillin, presents with a positive Venereal Disease Research Laboratory (VDRL) test. Considering her pregnancy and penicillin allergy, what is the most appropriate management for syphilis in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Desensitization to penicillin and then treatment with penicillin

questions.correct_answer: C. Desensitization to penicillin and then treatment with penicillin
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Desensitization to penicillin and then treatment with penicillin

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman presents to the clinic with symptoms of urinary incontinence. She reports a sensation of urgency followed by involuntary loss of urine. Her medical history is significant for type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Upon further evaluation, you consider the role of the detrusor muscle in her condition. In understanding the embryological origins of muscles, which of the following muscles is not derived from the paraxial mesoderm?

A 63-year-old female with a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia presents with palpitations and occasional dizziness. She denies any chest pain or shortness of breath. Her family history is significant for sudden cardiac death in her brother at the age of 50. On examination, her heart rate is irregular, and an ECG shows episodes of non-sustained ventricular tachycardia. An echocardiogram reveals mild right ventricular dilation with preserved ejection fraction. The patient's condition is related to abnormality of following cell junctions at marked area except.

A 38-year-old woman presents for her routine gynecological examination. She has an intrauterine device (IUD) for contraception and reports no significant medical history. Pap smear is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?

A First-Year Medical Student is discussing Embryological development with her professor. She learns about a key structure that forms early in Embryogenesis and is crucial for the establishment of the Body Axis and Germ Layer Formation. The professor asks her to identify this structure. The Primitive Streak, which is essential for this process, develops from which of the following Embryonic Layers?

In the pathogenesis of cholera, the cholera toxin exhibits its effect by binding to specific receptors on the host intestinal epithelial cells. Which receptor is primarily responsible for the binding of cholera toxin, leading to the subsequent intracellular signaling cascade?

A 23-year-old female presents with fever and altered sensorium for two days with rashes on legs as shown. Her BP is 70/50 mm Hg and neck stiffness is present. Lumbar puncture reveals cloudy CSF with 4200 cells/µL, protein level 198 and glucose 21 mg/ dL. Which of the following correctly describes the organism causing this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Gram negative diplococci (kidney shaped), oxidase positive

options.label: B
options.text: Gram negative diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

options.label: C
options.text: Gram positive cocci catalase negative, bacitracin sensitive

options.label: D
options.text: Gram positive diplococci (lanceolate), catalase negative, optochin sensitive

questions.correct_answer: B. Gram negative diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Gram negative diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

questions.text: An unimmunized 2-year old child presented with coryza, conjunctivitis, and bluish-white spots in his buccal mucosa near the lower molar teeth. A day later, he developed a maculopapular rash on the face and neck. What is the nature of the causative virus?

A microbiology lab is testing bacterial isolates from a patient with a suspected Shigella infection. One isolate is noted to ferment lactose slowly, with a positive result only after 48 hours of incubation. Which species of Shigella is known to exhibit this late lactose fermenting characteristic?
